results.title: Schoolboy, sailor, saint
results.creator_credit: Bavo Defurne, Anne Quirynen, Karel Doing, Studio 1, Laika Films and De Filmfabriek
results.brief_description: ‘Schoolboy, Sailor, Saint’ is a compilation of three short films (Saint, Particularly now, In spring and Sailor) from Belguim film maker Bavo Defurne, which explore gay desire, while paying homage to artists such as Jean Genet, Herbert List and Pierre and Gilles. Shot on b/w super-8 and using little sound, ‘Saint’ (1996) is both an indirect tribute to Genet’s homoerotic classic, “Un Chant d’Amore”, and a meditation on the violent death of Saint Sebastian. ‘Particularly now, in Spring’ (1995) is an idealised vision of youth which recounts a seventeen year old boy’s optimistic musings about his future, and the friendships he has forged with the boys at his sports club. The films visual style is influenced by pre-war German art, and by gay Jewish photographer Herbert List. The final film, ‘Sailor’ (1997) is a simply told tale of a boy’s yearning and unrequited love for a sailor, whose adventures at sea are imagined by the wistful boy. Shot on video, ‘Sailor’s‘ vibrant colours and highly stylised backdrops recall the luscious, camp archetypes of gay artists Pierre and Gilles. Cast includes: (Saint) Olaf Nollen, Alex van Stratum (Particularly now, in spring) Olaf Nollen (Sailor) Joram Schurmans, Tom de With.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Atoms for Peace”.
Regional and international co-operation of scientists ad governments in the development of peaceful se of atomic energy; and some of the achievements of this co-operation, sch as the flow of isotopes from one country to another, the transfer of fissionable materials for research purposes, and the establishment of international centres for atomic research. From the series “Atoms for peace”.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Atoms for Peace”.

results.title: Scorsese x 4: four short films by Martin Scorsese
results.creator_credit: Martin Scorsese and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: What’s a nice girl like you doing in a place like this?(USA, 1963, 9m) Scorsese’s first student production which was filmed on a shoestring budget and shows the influence of Fellini, Godard and Truffaut on the budding director. “It’s not just you, Murray!”(USA, 1964, 15m) combines the look of Italian cinema with the gangster film and is a definite step towards Scorsese’s later feature, “Mean Streets”(1973). “The Big Shave”(USA, 1967, 6m) was conceived as a protest against the Vietnam War and remains as one of his most enigmatic films. It went on to win the Prix L’Age d’Or at Ledoux’s Knokke Festival. “Italianamerican”(USA, 1974, 45m) belongs to a later phase of Scorsese’s career and is a highly personal and affectionate portrait of life in America through the eyes of his parents Charles and Catherine. It was financed by an NEH Bicentennial Award intended to encourage documentation of America’s immigrant communities, it was shot in the Scorsese family apartment on Elizabeth Street New York.

results.title: Score
results.brief_description: Soft-pornography/erotica from director Radley Metzger resplendent with witty dialogue, telephone repairman and funky music. Older married couple Elvira and Jack like to ‘swing’ and indulge frequently in sex parties with strangers or other couples. Betsy and Eddy are younger, naive newlyweds that become the latest object of desire for Elvira and Jack and the game is on to see who will win their conquest first. Eventually, Elvira and Betsy then Jack and Eddy form up to get high and get busy. A fantasy romp that includes dressing-up, drugs and mirrors. Cast includes Claire Wilbur, Calvin Culver, Lynn Lowry, Gerald Grant, Carl Parker.

results.title: ScooterZ: basics and beyond
results.brief_description: Presented by Eric Wiley, this short program with an energetic soundtrack shows beginners and advanced riders enjoying their ScooterZ - a mode of transport originating in Asia that has taken the world by storm. Everything from young boys getting about town, Razer Pro Team Riders, Go-PED Pro Team Riders and professional rollerbladers, in line skaters and other extreme forms of “board” sports. NB: This is not an instructional video, and not all riders wear helmets and knee pads. Rather it shows the possibilities of ScooterZ and the progression from skate boards to in line skating to ScooterZ and beyond.

results.title: Farming: Soviet style
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Soviet style”.
Examines the Soviet agricultural system, the collective farms, or Kolkhoz, the State farms, or Sovkhoz and the importance of the agricultural private plot. Credits include: photography by Dean Semler; script by Roger Milliss; edited by Martyn Down; sound by Howard Spry and commentary by Margaret Throsby.

results.title: Scoggie
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Scott and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: While most of Cape Breton’s youth leave for the excitement and opportunity of the big cities, twenty-seven-year-old Scoggie Watson remains, clinging to the things he cherishes most: the waters of Lake Bras d’Or, his hand-built sailboat, his freedom, and the friends who stayed behind. This is his story. It is a story that includes the hearty determination of some of the island people, a government scheme to develop marine farming on the Bras d’Or Lakes, and a mysterious stranger who has remained Scoggie’s hero since he was fourteen years old. Commentary by Donald Brittain.
